item.title: Generate Certificates and Private Keys in OpenSSL
item.description: Installation Install OpenSSL command line tools, using your favorite package manager. For Arch Linux $ sudo pacman -S openssl Key Generation RSA Keys To generate RSA private keys, run the following command: $ openssl genpkey -algorithm RSA -pkeyopt rsa_keygen_bits:<num_bits> -out privkey.pem replacing <num_bits> with number of bits you want for RSA key. Example: 2048 for a RSA 2048 key. To generate a self-signed certificate, run the following command: $ openssl req -new -x509 -days <days> -key privkey.
